item.ptxt: Do not disconnect any part of the fuel system until you have discharged the fuel system pressure.
Even after discharging the fuel pressure, place a cloth or equivalent over fittings as you separate them to reduce the risk of fuel spray on yourself or in the engine compartment.

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal.

atten2.ptxt: Wait at least 90 seconds after disconnecting the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal to prevent airbag activation.

s2.ptxt: Remove the front driver side scuff plate.

s3.ptxt: Using a screwdriver, detach the 7 claws.

atten4.ptxt: Tape the screwdriver tip before use.

s3.ptxt: Using a clip remover, detach the 3 clips and remove the scuff plate.

s2.ptxt: Turn up the floor carpet and disconnect the joining connector, as shown in the illustration.

atten4.ptxt: This connector has the lines of the fuel pump and rear speed sensor.

s2.ptxt: Connect the cable to the negative (-) battery terminal.
Start the engine. After the engine has stopped on its own, turn the ignition switch OFF.

atten4.ptxt: DTCs C0210/33 and C0215/34 (rear speed sensor circuit) and DTC P0171/25 (system too lean) may be set.

s2.ptxt: Crank the engine again, and then check that the engine does not start.
Loosen the fuel tank cap, and then discharge the pressure in the fuel tank completely.
Connect the fuel pump connector.
Install the front driver side scuff plate.
Clear the DTCs (see page ).

s-1.ptxt: DISCONNECT CABLE FROM NEGATIVE BATTERY TERMINAL

atten2.ptxt: Wait at least 90 seconds after disconnecting the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal to prevent airbag activation.

s2.ptxt: Remove the tube clamp from the fuel tube.

s-1.ptxt: DISCONNECT FUEL MAIN TUBE AND FUEL RETURN TUBE

s2.ptxt: Pinch and pull the main tube connector to disconnect the connector from the pipe. Then pinch and pull the return tube connector to disconnect the connector from the pipe.

item.ptxt: Check for foreign matter in the pipe and around the connector. Clean if necessary. Foreign matter may damage the O-ring or cause leaks in the seal between the pipe and connector.
Do not use any tools to separate the pipe and connector.
Do not forcefully bend or twist the nylon tube.
Check for foreign matter on the pipe seal surface. Clean if necessary.
Put the pipe and connector ends in plastic bags to prevent damage and foreign matter contamination.
If the pipe and connector are stuck together, pinch the connector between your fingers and turn it carefully to disconnect it.

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the vent line hose.

s-1.ptxt: DISCONNECT FUEL TANK TO FILLER PIPE HOSE

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the filler pipe hose from the fuel tank filler pipe.
Disconnect the breather hose from the fuel tank filler pipe.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FUEL TANK FILLER PIPE SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Remove the bolt and filler pipe.
Set a mission jack underneath the fuel tank.
Remove the 2 bolts, 2 clips, 2 pins and 2 fuel tank bands.
Slightly lower the mission jack and detach the 7 harness clips that are holding the wire harness to the fuel tank. Then disconnect the fuel gauge connector.

item.ptxt: Be careful not to cut the wirings.
Before this procedure, check the connector for dirt, mud or other contamination.
Do not use any tools in this procedure

s2.ptxt: Remove the 2 fuel tank cushions from the fuel tank.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FUEL SUCTION WITH PUMP AND GAUGE TUBE ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Remove the 2 tube joint clips and pull out the 2 fuel pump tubes.

item.ptxt: Before beginning this procedure, check for foreign matter in the fuel pump and gauge tube. Clean if necessary.
Keep the O-ring free of foreign matter, as it becomes contaminated easily.
Do not use any tools in this procedure.
Do not forcefully bend or twist the tube.
Put the tube in a plastic bag to prevent damage and contamination.
Protect the fuel pump and gauge tube's joint with tape or equivalent to prevent contamination from foreign matter.
If the fuel suction tube and tube are stuck together, pinch the tube and turn it carefully to disconnect it.

s2.ptxt: Press down on the fuel pump and remove the 8 bolts and set plate.

item.ptxt: When the retainer is loosened, be careful as the fuel pump will spring upward from the force of the spring.
Clean the fuel suction tube before this operation.

s2.ptxt: Remove the fuel gauge tube from the fuel tank.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to bend the arm of the fuel sender gauge.

s2.ptxt: Remove the gasket from the fuel tank.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE FUEL CUT OFF VALVE ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Remove the 4 bolts, fuel tank vent tube, gasket and fuel cut off valve.
Remove the fuel tube from the fuel tank vent tube.
Remove the 3 bolts and protector.
